ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Kindly stop forcing students to take the class. There may be underlying reasons that caused them to fail the E-Cap. Personally my internet was crappy and i could not get a private spot. The course is helpful but, forcing students to take it doesn't augur well.
William is a very responsive profession with a great patience. I really appreciate those linguistic instructions that he offered to me.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: This a an overall very useful and enjoyable class: 1) The knowledge and skills of the class are valuable, and the instructor explains them in a very explicit way; 2) With the practicum, students can practice the skills after the theoretical study, which is really useful for improvements. 3) In-class exams can help remind the previous knowledge that the students learned.
The practicums
The practicums
The best part of the course were the practicuum sessions.
Great skills for life.

The opportunity of practicing and improving our English language skills was unique. It helped me building more confidence and learn my cultural tips that are pretty important to navigate at F&ES and in the american environment. The practicum classes were very important to use the knowledge got in class. The presentation guidance and practice were very helpful!
Provided the discuss section for us to practice.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Maybe more contents regarding writing can be added (including assignments).
I think we should have had more conversation practices instead of lectures.
In my opinion this course would be much more useful for us international students, if we spent all classes practicing conversation/ fluency and vocabulary.
Some of the content in the lectures seemed pretty rote and inane, somewhat obvious. A great deal of it (such as the handshake part) could be left out.
Having some american TAs to practice during some classes would be great.

There are some topics that should be more explored, such as vocabulary, presentations and speaking practices with native speakers. The pronunciation class was very tiring and long and not as important as other aspects of spoken communication, that's why I think this class could be shorter or especially focused on the students that have more difficult. The class about wiring an e-mail was very obvious with a intuitive content, so I think that William shouldn't have spent a entire class on this topic. About the practicum, it could be more organized to allow students to practice for the same amount of time. There were classes that some students were not able to present their homework because of the lack of time remaining for them.
It could be more helpful to have short weekly writing assignments and/or brief speech deliver. I think that one 5 pages paper was not as helpful as could have been a weekly one (or half) page essay.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The relationship between the class and the practicum is terrific!
They were perfectly related.
Really effective, would be helpful to have more section hours on Thursdays.

Very effective, however the instructions gave in the lectures were, in some points, different from the instructions we got during the practicum. The instructors should achieve an agreement before they teach the topics.

Julie is a great instructor. I really enjoy her classes. However, I think that was not enough time to practice with her; I would suggest less students per section and more native speakers during the session helping to improve intonation and accent.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: English communication is the basis of all of my study at US, which can illustrate the importance of this class.
Excellent to improve communication skills.
Fundamental for any professional pursuing a carreer after grad school.
It was a good course. Nevertheless I think that a workshop style could be more helpful.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I'm an international student, and really eager to improve my English communication level. Although this class is so-called "required" for me, I planned to take it even before coming here. And it turns out to be really useful.
In order to develop my communication skills in English
To improve my communication skills
Mandatory in my case.
I had to take it, but I am really happy things turned out like this.

Because it was mandatory and to improve my English, especially my speaking skills. I took the course to get more fluency, vocabulary and confidence to speak and interact in formal and informal occasions.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes!
It was higher than my expectations.
Yes
Not really. It was a kind of refresher on subjects I already knew.
Yes, would like to practice the skills acquired more.

Yes, I learned a lot, but not as much as I expected. Maybe I had very high expectations at the beginning, but learning a language requires time and just one semester is not enough to improve as much as I would like to. I wish I had practice more speaking with native speakers. That practicum only with international is not very helpful.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Most valuable advantage was that I can have many chances to speak in English with a strategy that I learned about in a class.
I got got learn more about international classmates and what their struggles were

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: The most valuable part of this course are the practicuum sessions, which could probably be easily susbstituted by scheduling appointments with the shool's communication coach on your own.
Great course!
I would say that I learned a lot, but only because of my english level. So the learning depends on each one's English skills. If you have an advanced English, you don't have to take it.
